intro: Struthiola leptantha, commonly known as the slender-leaved struthiola, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
